body.p: Kentucky attorney, farmer, manufacturer, and politician. Attended Cumberland College in Princeton, Kentucky. Pursued farming and manufactured iron near Eddyville, Kentucky. Married to Margaret Aurelia Lyon Machen. Married to to Eliza W. Dobbins Machen. Married to Victoria Theresa Mims Machen. Father of Mary J. Machen, Henry L. Machen, Edward Chittenden Machen, Willis B. Machen, John S. Machen, Mary E. Machen, Elizabeth Machen, Minerva Buckner Machen, Frank Machen, Charles B. Machen, and Willis B. Machen. Member of the Kentucky Constitutional Convention in 1849 from Lyon County, Kentucky. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1854. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1856 to 1860. Member of the Council of Ten in the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Member of the First and Second Confederate Congresses representing the First Kentucky District from 1862 to 1865.
